tossups.question: This is the most common molecule administered during the hydrogen breath test, which detects the resulting production of methane and other gases. Chlorine and bromine are bound to the indoxyl (“in-DOX-eel”) component of an analogue to this molecule which produces the colors of the blue/white screen. Francois Jacob and Jacques Monod split the 1965 Nobel in Physiology for studying the structural genes Z, Y, and A, which allow E. coli to break down this molecule as part of a namesake (*) operon. In the majority of people the ability to metabolize this molecule does not persist, but many in Europe can continue to consume it beyond infanthood. For 10 points, name this disaccharide that is named for its isolation from cow’s milk.
tossups.answer: lactose [accept lactose fermentation or lactose intolerance; prompt on lac operon, lacZ, lacY, or lacA; prompt on milk, cheese, cream, or dairy before “milk”]

parts: This quantity increases over time due to natural selection. The “relative” form of this quantity is the change in abundance in a genotype, but it is better understood by its colloquial meaning as the ability to survive and thrive.

The idea of these entities self-perpetuating was considered by W. D. Hamilton and Richard Dawkins. Choosing these entities as the unit of selection allows a simple justification for altruism, as the concerns of the individual or the group are no longer central.

Much work on group selection centers on members of order Hymenoptera, which uses this system of sex determination in which drones and workers are distinguished by the number of sets of chromosomes they have.
